Name: Horse Stables, Fire Sprinklers
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the installation of fire sprinklers in horse stables.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

	Section 1.  Table 17-2 of article 4 of subchapter 17 of chapter 1 of title 27 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as last amended by local law number 10 for the year 1999, is amended by adding thereto a line following the last line of such table to read as follows:

TABLE 17-2  SUMMARY OF SPRINKLER REQUIREMENTS

Where Required
Type of System
Automatic
Sources Required

	�2.  Subdivision c of section 27-954 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as last amended by local law number 82 for the year 1973, is amended to read as follows:
	(c)  Buildings classified in storage occupancy group B-1 exceeding one thousand square feet in floor area, or seventy-five feet or more in height, except as modified under subdivisions a, b and c of section 27-455 of article ten of subchapter seven of this code and under subdivision aa of this section.
	�3.  The opening paragraph of subdivision d of section 27-954 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as last amended by local law number 82 for the year 1973, is amended to read as follows:
	(d)  Spaces classified in storage occupancy group B-1 exceeding five hundred square feet in floor area, except as modified under subdivisions a, b and c of section 27-455 of article ten of subchapter seven of this code and under subdivision aa of this section.
	�4.  Section 27-954 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as last amended by local law number 10 for the year 1999, is amended by adding a new subdivision aa to read as follows:
	aa.  Buildings and spaces classified in storage occupancy group B-1 that are used as a stable by a person, establishment or facility for four or more horses.  Notwithstanding any other provisions of law, the sprinkler system may be connected to the domestic water supply.  However, any such stables existing at the enactment of this subdivision shall be made to comply with the provisions of this subdivision by July first, two thousand two.
	�5.  This local law shall take effect immediately.

\pard\ltrpar\sl480\slmult1\tab\'a72.  Subdivision c of section 27-954 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as last amended by local law number 82 for the year 1973, is amended to read as follows:\par
\tab (c)  Buildings classified in storage occupancy group B-1 exceeding one thousand square feet in floor area, or seventy-five feet or more in height, except as modified under subdivisions a, b and c of section 27-455 of article ten of subchapter seven of this code and under subdivision aa of this section.\par
\tab\'a73.  The opening paragraph of subdivision d of section 27-954 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as last amended by local law number 82 for the year 1973, is amended to read as follows:\par
\tab (d)  Spaces classified in storage occupancy group B-1 exceeding five hundred square feet in floor area, except as modified under subdivisions a, b and c of section 27-455 of article ten of subchapter seven of this code and under subdivision aa of this section.\par
\tab\'a74.  Section 27-954 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as last amended by local law number 10 for the year 1999, is amended by adding a new subdivision aa to read as follows:\par
\tab aa.  Buildings and spaces classified in storage occupancy group B-1 that are used as a stable by a person, establishment or facility for four or more horses.  Notwithstanding any other provisions of law, the sprinkler system may be connected to the domestic water supply.  However, any such stables existing at the enactment of this subdivision shall be made to comply with the provisions of this subdivision by July first, two thousand two.\par
\tab\'a75.  This local law shall take effect immediately.\par
